content.description:
The Sun Drains Heavy ascends a slightly overhanging face on perfect stone over an outstanding landing.

Sit start with a right hand edge on the arete and a left hand on the shelf/jug. From there, move up to a perfect left hand edge, get a high right toe, move to a right hand broken edge, cross over with a big right to a sloper jug (the texture!), work the remaining edges, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will be fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Two Balloons.

content.description: Stand start with any combination of incut edges. From there, climb up and slightly right to better edges below the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work. The landing is good, but there are few rock presents.
content.location: It climbs the center east face of Two Balloons.

content.description: Stand start on the east side of the northeast arete. From there, climb up and slight left on good edges to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Two Balloons' east face.

content.description: Sit start with a small, but positive right hand sidepull and a sloping left hand on the corner. From there, pull up to the crimp rail above, traverse right along it, reach the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine, the landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Two Balloons.
